Tweets: WATCH LIVE: Governor Ron DeSantis Makes a Major Announcement in Juno Beach

Today I am making a major announcement in Juno Beach. Tune in at 2PM to the @floridachannel
 or .

As we move forward with our #SafeSmartStepbyStep Plan for Florida’s Recovery, I am confident we will overcome the adversities before us and emerge stronger than before. For more information on the Fiscal Year 2020-21 Budget, click here - .

Despite the #COVID19 pandemic, Florida continues to maintain strong reserves in the 2020-21 budget, totaling $6.3 billion. This includes the $1 billion in vetoes as well as reversions of $781 million from FY 2019-20.
The budget includes $6M to make FL’s correctional facilities safer, including $3M for security equipment. It also provides important funding for pay increases for correctional officers.

Florida's budget continues to make necessary investments in public safety. The budget includes $2.3M to implement the first Statewide Behavioral Threat Assessment strategy in the country and more than $8.1M to expand and enhance Florida’s crime databases.

We are committed to ensuring the legal rights of Florida’s elderly population are protected and included $8.7 million in funding to support the Office of Public and Professional Guardianship in the 2020-21 budget.

The health and well-being of all Floridians is paramount. The state budget provides $117.6M in funding for children & families who receive services through FL’s child welfare system, including $53M for major reforms to enhance accountability.

We are mindful that 2020 is an election year and the budget provides $10 million for state-level election oversight activities, with a focus on cybersecurity enhancements to Florida’s election system.
Florida's 2020-21 budget includes $1.3 billion in federal and state funding for communities to respond to, recover from, and mitigate against major disasters or emergencies.

Despite #COVID19, we remain focused on investing in FL's transportation infrastructure:
✅$9.2B for the State Transportation Work Program
✅$2.5B for highway construction
✅$400.5M for aviation improvements
✅$885.5M for rail/transit projects 
✅$236.4M for safety initiatives

The 2020-21 budget includes:
✅More than $322M for Everglades restoration 
✅$50M for springs restoration
✅$160M for targeted water quality improvements
✅$40M for alternative water supply
✅$25M to combat harmful algal blooms & red tide
✅$100M for Florida Forever

With this budget, we are more than halfway to our goal of securing $2.5 billion for Florida’s environment. For the second fiscal year in a row, we have secured more than $625 million for Everglades restoration & the protection of water resources.
I am proud that Florida's FY 2020-21 budget provides an increase of $18.9 million for Florida’s Historically Black Colleges and Universities.

To continue building on the success of Florida’s higher education system, the budget includes historic state operating funding for the Florida College System and State University System at $1.3 billion and $2.7 billion respectively. It does not include any tuition increases.
Florida's K-12 education budget for the upcoming fiscal year includes record per student funding of $7,793, an increase of current year spending by $137 per student.

Last year I vowed to make 2020 the “Year of the Teacher” and I'm proud to follow through on that promise. The budget includes $500M to raise the minimum K-12 teacher salary into the nation's Top 5 & increase salaries for veteran teachers & other eligible personnel.
To that end, I vetoed $1 billion of the $93.2 billion state budget previously approved by lawmakers. These were not easy decisions and $550 million represent cuts from my own budget recommendations.
Today I signed Florida's state budget for Fiscal Year 2020-21. As Governor, I must ensure our state remains on a strong fiscal foundation during #COVID19.

In case you missed it, I was pleased to announce Florida’s next Supreme Court Justices … John Couriel, the son of Cuban exiles, and Judge Renatha Francis, the first Jamaican-American to be named to our state’s highest court.

She understands that the judiciary must apply the law of the Constitution as written, not rewrite them in service of political preferences. Judge Francis is also a mother of two boys including a one-month old. She will join the court in September.
My appointment of Judge Renatha Francis to the Florida Supreme Court is historic – a naturalized citizen, Francis will be the first Jamaican-American to serve on the court.

The son of Cuban exiles, John Couriel understands the importance of the rule of law and a written constitution. As a Florida Supreme Court Justice, John will interpret the law and Constitution as written and won’t legislate from the bench.

In case you missed it, I joined @IngrahamAngle last night to discuss Florida’s data-driven approach to flattening the curve and protecting our most vulnerable residents during #COVID19.

Enjoyed meeting with @OCFLMayor Jerry Demings and small business owners recently at a hair salon in Orlando. Floridians are creative people and together we will find a way to get these good folks back in business.
Our men and women of the @FLGuard are protecting vulnerable residents in nursing homes and assisted living facilities during #COVID19. We salute you!
With Mother’s Day around the corner I stopped by Rusted Arrow in Pensacola to pick up some gifts.  Great store in a beautiful downtown area!

Today I received a briefing on the #FiveMileSwampFire from @SRC_EM, @SRSheriffFL & @FLForestService. We have already received approval on our @FEMA request for federal financial assistance. Thank you President @realDonaldTrump for helping the good folks of Northwest Florida.

I’m heading to Santa Rosa County this morning to receive a briefing from local officials on the 2,000-acre wildfire. We’re closely monitoring this situation with @FLSERT and I’ve requested @fema to provide financial assistance to the county.

This year’s National Day of Prayer comes as we navigate our way through a difficult time that has impacted all of us. As we continue to fight to alleviate the effects of #COVID19, let us lean on God in prayer to become more resilient in the face of fear and crisis.
Nursing homes are ground zero for #COVID19 and that’s why we have been deploying innovative and proactive methods to expedite testing of vulnerable residents.
PPE will continue to be essential to our #COVID19 response, particularly as we progress through my Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step. Plan to re-open Florida.

Florida has launched the only state-sponsored rapid-test mobile lab that we're aware of in the country. We continue to lead the way on innovative testing.

✅500 tests per day
✅45-minute turnaround
✅10 nurses and 10 Guardsmen assigned
✅Focus on long-term care facilities

Florida's new Critical Care Decontamination System is a gamer changer. The facility at Hard Rock Stadium can decontaminate up to 80,000 masks per day and decontaminate the same mask 20 times. 

We are working with @fema to have additional Florida sites added as needed.

Florida is leading the way on innovative testing for #COVID19. Today I was joined by @MayorGimenez at Hard Rock Stadium to announce the only state-sponsored mobile testing lab and share cutting edge technology being used to decontaminate PPE.
We are taking action to protect those who are suffering from mental health and substance abuse during the #COVID19 pandemic.

I have directed @AHCA_FL Secretary Mary Mayhew to issue an emergency rule requiring hospitals to test all individuals that will be discharged to a long-term care facility, regardless of whether the individual is symptomatic.

On #NationalNursesDay, we honor the more than 430,000 licensed registered nurses and practical nurses here in Florida.
 
Our nurses are heroes on the frontlines of the #COVID19 pandemic. To that end, I have proclaimed the entire month of May as Florida Nurses Month.
Pleased to announce the launch of Florida’s new mobile testing lab, which will allow us to exponentially increase our proactive testing efforts at long-term care facilities.

I recently met with physicians in Broward County @CleveClinicFL where they highlighted optimism for Florida’s future.
 
I agree Dr. Barsoum, by working together, we will be victorious!

Great job to all involved!

The past 2 months have been difficult and many of us have experienced hardships and uncertainty. My Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step. Plan for Florida's Recovery will lead to our state’s next phase. There is a light at the end of the tunnel.
ICYMI, today I laid out Phase One of my Safe. Smart. Step-by-Step. Plan for Florida's Recovery.

Florida has done better than anyone predicted. We have a big, diverse state that requires a tailored and measured approach. Data and science have helped us flatten the curve in a safe way.
Thank you, Dr. Birx. Our commitment to high-volume testing and a data-driven approach has helped us flatten the curve.

Great meeting with President @realDonaldTrump at the @WhiteHouse discussing all things #COVID19 and FL's strong efforts to protect vulnerable populations & to expand testing in an innovative way. @POTUS & his administration have provided great support for FL each step of the way.

ICU bed availability in Florida hospitals has increased during the span of this pandemic. In fact, Miami-Dade, which has nearly 40% of all FL cases, had 45% of its ICU beds available as of 4/27. Thank you to all of our health care workers and systems for doing such a great job!
Florida has flattened the curve. Our state continues to ramp up #COVID19 testing, our hospitalizations remain low, and we are on the right path to safely re-opening our economy.
.@MayorGimenez, @ReadyBroward and @pbcgov demonstrated a thoughtful approach to re-opening parks, marinas and golf courses.
Taking advantage of less traffic, work for the widening of I-275 over Westshore Blvd in Tampa’s busy Westshore District is moving swiftly. Completion is now estimated to be 60 days ahead of schedule.

Kudos to @HealthyFla for including a new chart tracking the trend in positivity rates for Coronavirus tests. The last two days (4/24 and 4/25) have been 5.2% and 4.5% respectively. Very positive trend!

Great meeting today with the talented physicians and medical experts @orlandohealth. Hospitalization rates have decreased across Florida and our expanded testing shows a decline in the rate of those testing positive for #COVID19. Watch full video here:
Your job and paycheck are important, and we are working hard to take a safe, smart, step-by-step approach to re-opening our economy.
Public policy and health policy must continue to go hand in hand. I want to thank the doctors and health care professionals volunteering their time to serve on my Re-Open Florida Task Force.

The two new walk up #COVID19 testing sites here in @BrowardCounty with @ulbroward are significant. Not everyone has access to a car or the ability to travel to drive-thru sites. These sites will increase accessibility for testing.

Florida has received $4.1 billion from the federal CARES Act to aid the state in responding to and recovering from #COVID19. Together, we will get through this difficult time and emerge stronger than before.

Had a very productive #COVID19 response roundtable this morning with @FLDEO Director Ken Lawson, @FloridaDMS Secretary Jonathan Satter and @FloridaRevenue Director Jim Zingale to ensure Floridians receive their assistance quicky.

I appreciate @FedEx’s willingness to help Floridians in a time of need. Starting today, over 100 @FedEx storefronts throughout the state are providing free printing and mailing of reemployment assistance applications.

As of 11 am today, we’ve tested 102K people for #COVID19 – making Florida second in the nation for testing. I appreciate the efforts of @FLSERT, @HealthyFla, @FLGuard and all of the health care workers and first responders on the front lines of this fight.
I appreciated the time with @TeamCavuto today to discuss the challenges facing Florida ports with passengers on ships that carry COVID-19.

As we continue to fight the spread of #COVID19, I encourage every Floridian to utilize the resources available below. My administration is focused on providing as much help as possible to the people of Florida. We will get through this together.

We are forever grateful for your efforts and are proud to stand with you in this fight against #COVID19.
Counting our blessings. Casey and the kids are doing great.

Thank you, President @realDonaldTrump for approving Florida’s Disaster Declaration which will provide federal funds to help communities recover from the effects of #COVID19. We are prepared for the fight ahead and will come out stronger than ever before.

Dr. Birx and Dr. Fauci agree; there is too high a risk that travelers from the NY Tri-State Area have been exposed to #COVID19. I appreciate their support for my executive order requiring such individuals flying into FL to self-quarantine for 14 days.

Yesterday I sent a letter to @HHSGov Assistant Secretary Robert Kadlec requesting the release of 61 Florida residents from Georgia, many of whom are elderly, who were previously aboard the Grand Princess voyage outside of California. It is time to bring these Floridians home.

All 67 Florida counties are currently offering early voting. @FLSecofState is in constant communication with Supervisors of Elections regarding readiness for elections and @CDCgov recommendations for polling locations related to #COVID19. More:

Voters may consider picking up a vote-by-mail ballot for the March 17th election, which can also be picked up by a designee (form required) & returned by 7pm on Election Day. Designee "affidavit" forms are available in English and Spanish. More:  #COVID19

I have issued an Executive Order declaring a State of Emergency to establish a unified command structure and direct funds as necessary in response to #COVID19. 

EO:

I have directed @FLSERT to activate to Level II to ensure Florida has all the necessary resources engaged as we respond to #COVID19. It is critical that we proactively coordinate all state resources to mitigate and contain #COVID19.

Today, we awarded $2.2 million to Gadsden County through the Hurricane Michael State Recovery Grant Program. This funding, administered by @FLSERT, will help repair two important bridges for Gadsden residents. More here -
Happy to honor an American legend with this proclamation as a tribute to his many contributions to Florida.

This morning, we recognized the @FLGuard in celebration of National Guard Day at the Capitol. To those who are currently serving or have served in the National Guard, our state and nation are sincerely grateful for your selfless service and sacrifice.

On March 3rd, 1845, Florida officially became the 27th state of the United States of America. 175 years later, our state remains a leader in healthcare, low taxes, and endless sunshine. It is a privilege to work for fellow Floridians every day. #Florida175
Tomorrow I will be in Tampa and Miami with Surgeon General Rivkees and other officials to discuss our continued statewide response on #COVID19.

Today I had the opportunity to discuss Coronavirus preparedness in Florida with @VP Pence. I requested the Vice President help provide local testing kits, additional medical supplies & federal supplementation for those that may be held in isolation for an extended period of time.

Today I signed HB 1087 removing the Florida Coalition Against Domestic Violence from statute. Floridians deserve greater accountability from their government, especially survivors. I commend Pres. @BillGalvano and Speaker @RepJoseOliva for taking swift action on this legislation.

By pardoning the Groveland Four, the State of Florida recognized the miscarriage of justice that occurred in that case. By unveiling this monument, Lake County is pledging to remember this history and to pledge itself to stand for justice for all of its citizens.
I was pleased to award the City of Green Cove Springs in Clay County with $250,000 through the Job Growth Grant Fund today. Details here -

Today, @MyFWC approved a 45-day Gulf Red #Snapper Season from June 11th-25th for Gulf state and federal waters. Gulf red snapper season is an exciting time for anglers and is just another reason why Florida remains the Fishing Capital of the World.
We look forward to the positive impacts this program will have on the lives of our veterans and the communities in which they live.

I’m excited to share my administration’s newest veteran-focused initiative: the “Salute Our Soldiers” Military Housing Loan Program for veterans and active duty military personnel throughout the state. Details here –

Today, it was my pleasure to announce that my administration is awarding the @cityofpensacola $4.8 million through the Florida Job Growth Grant Fund for infrastructure enhancements to @flypensacola. More here –

Enjoyed celebrating #GatorDay at the Florida Capitol today with @GatorsFB Head Coach @CoachDanMullen. On top of an excellent football program, @UF is also the 7th ranked public university in the nation. The best is yet to come for the Florida Gators!

Thank you to @SecElaineChao for coming to Miami to make this major announcement for our state’s infrastructure. These grants will allow for critical expansion projects that are vital to the economic success of @PortMiami, @PortCanaveral and Florida overall.

Our state and nation continue to mourn the innocent lives that were taken two years ago in a senseless act of violence at @MSDHighSchool. In memory of those lives lost, the Florida State Capitol has been lit all week in the MSD school colors.
This innovative collaboration to provide new FinTech-related training and certifications will help equip Floridians with skills in demand by Northeast Florida’s growing FinTech industry.
I’m pleased to launch the Northeast Florida FinTech Initiative in conjunction with Florida State College at Jacksonville and St. John’s River State College. More info here –

The tax credit scholarship program provides educational opportunities to more than 100,000 low-income families in Florida. I support these families and am glad to see @FifthThird continue to do so as well. Thanks for empowering parents and students!

We are closely monitoring a strong cold front moving through North Florida. A tornado watch has already been issued this morning & more watches & warnings are expected throughout the day. Make sure to follow @FLSERT and local media for updates.

.@FLCaseyDeSantis and I mourn the death of FHP Trooper Joseph Bullock of Troop L - Fort Pierce who was killed today in the line of duty. We are keeping the Bullock family, Troop L and our @FLHSMV family in our prayers.

Today, the Florida Cabinet and I approved two Florida Forever land acquisitions and agreed to acquire a conservation easement that will protect Florida’s fragile natural environments in Manatee, Sarasota and Columbia counties. Info here –
Under the current circumstances, I believe moving the case under State Attorney King’s jurisdiction provides the best chance for the Montalvo family to receive the justice they deserve.

After review by my office and consultation with the Montalvo family, today I am issuing an executive reassignment of the Nicole Montalvo murder case to State Attorney Brad King of the Fifth Judicial Circuit. See Executive Order here –
We have worked tirelessly to get recovery dollars to all areas impacted by Hurricane Irma and will continue to do so as quickly and efficiently as possible.

Today, @FLDEO awarded more than $84 million to 21 communities impacted by Hurricane Irma through their Rebuild Florida Infrastructure Repair Program, which helps fund infrastructure restoration and improvements. See more here –

Thank you @FLDEPNews Secretary @NoahValenstein and @MyFWC Executive Director Eric Sutton for your hard work and environmental stewardship. By protecting and restoring Florida’s coral reef, we are protecting a state treasure. See details here –

Today, I’m excited to help kickoff 100 Yards of Hope, a project by the veterans of @forceblueteam to plant 100 yards of coral while honoring the @NFL’s 100th season. I’m also proud to announce a new initiative to promote awareness and protection of Florida’s Coral Reef ecosystem.
I’m honored to be named a 2019 Rx Price Fighter by @AARP today on Florida Senior Day. I will continue to work to identify innovative ways to reduce health care costs for Floridians.

I was proud to share with them that in January alone, @FLSERT paid out more than $100 million for hurricane recovery and more than $1.5 billion since I took office. Helping communities recover remains a priority for my administration.
.@FLCaseyDeSantis and I enjoyed taking time today to celebrate all the Emergency Management Directors throughout Florida at the first-ever Emergency Management Day at the Capitol.
With this new strategy, Florida is the first state in the nation to have a statewide behavioral threat assessment and management program.

One month after taking office, I asked @fdlepio to develop & implement a threat assessment strategy to help prevent acts of targeted violence in FL – . Today, I’m pleased to announce that FDLE & the statewide steering committee have completed that request.
Honored to be at the @WhiteHouse with President @realDonaldTrump and @IsraeliPM Netanyahu for today's announcement of a strong, pro-Israel peace plan.
I hope that this initiative will have a strong impact on classrooms and school campuses across our state as we look to build a bolder, brighter, and better education system in Florida.

Today, I’m pleased to announce my support for the Florida Civics and Debate Initiative with The Marcus Foundation to provide opportunities for Florida students to debate issues related to American civics. Info here –

On International #HolocaustRemembranceDay, we remember and honor the memory of the 6 million Jews whose lives were horrifically taken. Today and every day, we stand in solidarity with our Jewish communities in Florida and around the world.

I’m proud to share that in December 2019, Florida’s unemployment rate dropped to 3% - the lowest in our history. Florida remains the best state in the nation to find a job and start or grow a business. Details here –

The crisis in Venezuela is a great concern to many Floridians and impacts the security of the United States. @SecPompeo was kind enough to visit us in Miami and listen to concerns from the Venezuelan exile community.
Great to visit community leaders and celebrate #MLKDay in Gretna this morning. Thank you to Mayor Jeff McNealy and @GadsdenSheriff Morris Young for having me.
My administration remains committed to supporting Florida’s growing aerospace industry and maintaining an economic climate that allows companies like Made In Space to prosper. See more here –

I'm proud to announce that @MadeInSpace has decided to relocate their corporate headquarters from the highly-taxed, highly-regulated state of California, to the business friendly environment of Florida.
This study demonstrates that maintaining and protecting military bases and industry in Florida is vital to the economic success of our state.

The results of @EnterpriseFL’s 2020 Florida Military and Defense Economic Impact Study are in: Florida’s military and defense industry has a $95 billion economic impact, a $10 billion increase from the 2017 study. More info here –

I enjoyed touring @PortTampaBay with the facility’s President and CEO Paul Anderson. Port Tampa Bay is Florida’s largest port and is a pillar of our state’s economy. The future is bright for the Tampa Bay area!

I am pleased that @FLCourts confirms that Amendment 4 requires fines, fees & restitution be paid to victims before their voting rights may be restored. Voting is a privilege that should not be taken lightly, and I am obligated to faithfully implement Amendment 4 as it is defined.

Yesterday, @FLCaseyDeSantis and I were honored to host @NASCAR leadership at the Governor’s Mansion. NASCAR is a part of Florida’s sporting DNA and a major economic engine generating thousands of jobs and injecting more than $1.6 billion annually into our economy.

Enjoyed speaking at @FlChamber’s #FCCFlyIn20 today to discuss Florida’s low taxes, reasonable regulatory climate and positive disposition toward business. Our state continues to thrive, and our business leaders continue to pave the way for Florida’s success.

.@FLCaseyDeSantis and I are keeping Officer Paul Dunn of Lakeland and his family in our prayers today. I have ordered flags to be flown at half-staff to honor his memory. A husband, a father and a veteran—Officer Dunn will always be remembered as a hero.
This purchase would be the largest wetland acquisition in a decade and will permanently save the land from oil drilling. See more here –
I’m pleased to announce that @FLDEPNews has reached an agreement with Kanter Real Estate that will allow for the purchase of 20,000 acres of critical wetlands in the Everglades.
In this season of opportunity, we can say there is more out there to achieve for our state – and there is no reason why we can’t seize this moment and deliver for the people of Florida.

For everything there is a season, and this is Florida’s season of opportunity – we have the chance to build on a strong foundation, the chance to face the challenges before us and the chance to leave a legacy of success that will benefit our people now and in the future.

The Legislature approved a $25 million Hurricane Michael grant program for assisting with the recovery in NW Florida. 

Michael was a catastrophic storm and while great progress has been made, this is a long-term effort. I ask that you re-up this grant program for another year.

Hurricane recovery has been a priority for my administration. In January of 2019, I asked @FLSERT to expedite reimbursements to affected areas & the agency has distributed more than $1.4 billion to communities impacted by hurricanes Michael, Irma, Matthew and Hermine.
This can only be done with federal approval and I’m happy to report that the Trump administration is moving forward with the applicable regulations.
One major initiative was to provide access to cheaper prescription drugs by bringing in safe, name-brand drugs from foreign markets such as Canada. Same drug, just a much lower price.

With the Speaker and President leading the way, the 2019 Legislative session witnessed major reforms in the area of health care – from expanding access to telehealth to repealing antiquated regulations.

Results matter and accountability is needed. But the Common Core framework was clearly flawed.

I can reveal that one key to our replacement of Common Core will be a renewed emphasis on American civics and the US Constitution.
All Florida parents, regardless of income or zip code, should have the ability to choose the best school for their children.

Last year, we had nearly 13,000 low-income families on the waiting list for a tax credit scholarship. Thanks to the enactment of the new Family Empowerment scholarship, these families have been liberated from the waiting list.

Our approach to K-12 education rests on (1) recruiting and retaining great teachers, (2) promoting educational choice so parents, particularly low-income parents, can place their child in a good school, and (3) measuring results through accountability.

Low taxes and a healthy business climate are important in attracting investment in Florida, but so too is our ability to produce top-flight talent – through our colleges and universities, through workforce education opportunities and through strong K-12 schools.

We have strong momentum and need to keep it going. We have a chance to take bold action to make a lasting positive impact upon Florida’s environment.  

Let’s seize this opportunity.
This vision required a commitment from the Legislature, and you delivered – to the tune of more than $625 million for water resources and Everglades projects.
When I took office, I issued a sweeping executive order outlining a bold approach to protecting our natural resources, improving water quality and restoring the Everglades.

Florida must remain steadfast in its commitment to low taxes and fiscal responsibility. Maintaining fiscal health will provide the type of durable foundation required for the expansion of our economic base, which means more opportunities for the people of Florida.
While we should look with favor on these bold beginnings, we have much more to do.

In 2019, we took bold steps to expand educational opportunities, protect our environment and natural resources, reform health care, invest in infrastructure and bolster public safety – all while reducing taxes and adding to our budget reserves.
It brings me great satisfaction to report on the promising prospects of our public affairs and to commend the members of the House and Senate for your efforts to make Florida successful.

Tomorrow I will deliver the State of the State address to a joint session of the Florida Legislature & Floridians everywhere. I look forward to a successful legislative session & working to ensure a brighter, better future for all. 

Watch my address live on the @floridachannel.

I’m pleased to hear @DollarTree will be opening a new distribution center in Marion County. This center is projected to create 600 jobs with a capital investment that is estimated to surpass $200 million: a big win for both Marion County and Florida.

I thank Chairman John Rood and the @FloridaPrepaid College Board for their work and leadership. This price reduction is great news for hardworking Florida families looking to invest in their children’s future.
Today I announced that @FloridaPrepaid will lower Prepaid Plan prices by $1.3 billion, a reduction benefitting 224,000 current customers. See details here –

As severe weather approaches our state today, every resident in NW FL should be prepared for heavy rain, strong winds, and be ready to seek shelter if a tornado warning is issued. Follow @FLSERT and local media for updates.

We are closely monitoring a strong cold front with @FLSERT that is expected to bring severe weather to Northwest Florida tomorrow. This system is capable of producing tornadoes & strong winds of more than 60mph. Make sure you have a plan & take any watches & warnings seriously.

I am hopeful the Python Bowl brings much needed public awareness and engagement on this critical issue: pythons are severely disrupting natural food chains and continue to threaten endangered species.
Today kicks off the 2020 #PythonBowl, where participants will head into the Everglades to remove invasive Burmese pythons. More info here -

Hurricane Michael left devastating impacts throughout NW FL and communities are still trying to rebuild. Today I announced over $5 million through @FLDEO's Rural Infrastructure Fund to help these communities recover. Details here -

While I’m proud of our progress so far, I look forward to working with the Legislature this upcoming legislative session to deliver more wins for Florida’s environment; the fight to protect and preserve our state’s natural resources is far from over.
One year ago today I signed Executive Order 19-12 to implement major environmental reforms. See the EO here -

We are forever indebted to the men and women who answer the call of duty and put their lives on the line by running into harm’s way. Today, we recognize the sacrifice you and your families make every day to keep us safe. #LawEnforcementAppreciationDay

One year ago, I named Barbara Lagoa to @FLCourts – the first Cuban-American woman to serve on FL’s highest bench. Today, she serves on the @USCourts 11th Circuit where she continues to uphold the rule of law through principle-based decisions. Her replacement will do the same.

.@SpiritAirlines is a major job creator for our state, & we are excited that they have chosen to expand their FL footprint with a new corporate campus. Today’s groundbreaking is just another indication that Florida remains the best state in the nation to start or grow a business.

.@FLCaseyDeSantis and I send our sincerest condolences to @JimmyPatronis and @katiepatronis for the passing of Jimmy’s father, Jimmy Patronis, Sr. You and your family are in our thoughts and prayers during this difficult time.

Great news for Florida’s education system – the graduation rate continued to increase last year, climbing to 86.9%, & has risen over 27% since 2003-04. I applaud FL's students, parents & educators for their hard work that lead to these positive results.

One year ago today, I took the oath of office to become Governor of this great state. It’s an honor to work every day on behalf of Floridians and I look forward to our continued efforts to create a bolder, brighter, better future for all.

I look forward to working closely with the @POTUS @realDonaldTrump administration including @HUDgov, @US_EDA and @USTreasury on this initiative which will bring more high wage jobs and opportunities for Floridians. More info here –

It was great to be joined by @SpaceFlorida President Frank DiBello as well as @EnterpriseFL President @JamalSowell to confirm my administration’s commitment to promoting opportunity zones in the Melbourne area.

Enjoyed the great opportunity to speak at the @FloridaChiefs 2020 Mid-Winter Training Conference in Orlando. @FLCaseyDeSantis and I stand with and extend our highest gratitude to the men and women in blue for their efforts to keep Florida safe day in and day out.

FL’s Complete Count Committee will coordinate with the @uscensusbureau to help facilitate a complete and accurate count of FL residents. I have appointed @LtGovNunez to lead a group of diverse committee members to fulfill this important duty. More info -

The U.S. Constitution mandates a national census count be conducted every 10 years and Florida will do its part to support the federal government’s efforts. Therefore, today I announced the designation of Florida's 2020 Census Statewide Complete Count Committee.

My administration, along with @elderaffairs Secretary Richard Prudom and @HealthyFLa Surgeon General Scott Rivkees are committed in the fight to end Alzheimer’s. #ENDALZ @alzassociation @AlzAdvocacyFL

I'd like to thank Caylor Branham, an extraordinary young man, as well as his mother @Mbranham27, for designing and creating these signs to spread awareness for Floridians living with dementia and their caregivers. #ENDALZ

In the first week of this new year alone, @FLSERT has awarded nearly $29M in hurricane recovery dollars. In 2019, we awarded more than $1.4B in hurricane recovery dollars & we remain steadfast in our commitment to hurricane recovery in 2020. Info -

I am pleased to announce more than $5.2M is being awarded to small and rural FL communities to improve infrastructure. We will continue to invest in our state's infrastructure to help attract new businesses and create opportunities for residents. Info -

The DeSantis family would like to extend a Happy New Year to all. I am proud of what we were able to accomplish this past year and look forward to an even more successful year in 2020. Wishing everyone a safe and Happy New Year!
